item.name: Mote Bead
entries: {@bold Subtype}: Spell Component
{@item }:

Mote beads are actually the {@ italic corpses} of {@monster motes}; they appear as tiny gold beads or grains that softly glow, shedding dim light in a 5-foot radius. In addition, if eaten, the bead provides one days sustenance for a Medium creature and heals 1 hit point. People capable of casting Healing spells will find more beads much more useful. A mote bead can be added as an optional material component (which will consume the Mote bead) to any Cure Wounds spell, adding a bonus as follows: Cure Wounds: the range becomes 30ft (The spell effectively becomes a ray Roll to hit with advantage against prone creatures. Healing Word: if cast immediately after the target takes damage, the healing effectively prevents the damage. Mass Cure Wounds: increase the healing by 1d8. Goodberry: each berry heals 2hp, and provides full day food and water.

item.name: Fire Flower Seed
entries: {@bold subtype}: Herb

Strawberries with seeds that form patterns of tiny dragonflies upon their surface 1d4+1 Strawberries in a bunch Once consumed, summons a dragonfly which will send a message to a single entity. Can also return with a single message from the original recipient to the sender
{@bold Description} (Player Facing): Thin brown salted seeds.
{@bold Feature} (GM facing): Allows you to absorb fire damage once for the next 24 hours. This effect cannot be stacked. You may only have the effects of 2 food items at once.

item.name: The Stained Glass
entries: {@bold subtype}: Herb

Strawberries with seeds that form patterns of tiny dragonflies upon their surface 1d4+1 Strawberries in a bunch Once consumed, summons a dragonfly which will send a message to a single entity. Can also return with a single message from the original recipient to the sender
{@bold Description} (Player Facing): A dark blue mixed drink served with a lemon wedge on therim of a tall slim glass. Served at The Glass Teardrop.

{@bold Feature} (GM facing): If consumers pass a DC 7 Constitution save, they gain +5 to Persuasion for the next 24 hours. If they fail, at a random point within the next 24 hours, they will become {@condition blinded} for 1 hour.

monster.name: Clockwork Horse

trait.name: Loud Machinery
entries: The horse has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Vent Stream {@recharge 5}
entries: The horse exhales steam at a creature within 5 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 13 (2d12) fire damage.

monster.description: {@bold Clockwork Horses} are durable, untiring mounts. However they are very complex to create and maintain, and loud when active.

monster.name: Jaguar

trait.name: Ambusher.
entries: The jaguar has advantage on attack rolls against surprised creatures.

trait.name: Keen Smell.
entries: The jaguar has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

monster.description: {@bold Jaguars} are jungle stalkers, suitable as mounts for goblins, halflings, gnomes, and other small folk.

trait.name: Loud Machinery

action.name: Hooves
